result.execSummary:
The defendant Karl J Lindner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration
and Substance Abuse Programs. 
Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Operation of motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Pay court ordered child support. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Commencing forthwith. FIRST 90 days are Straight Time. While on Straight Time, defendant to be released for Treatment ONLY and must be verified by treatment provider and subject to Huber approval.  Balance of sentence to be non-working hours, release for standard conditions.

Dated April 3, 2017, from WCSD, giving notice that the Defendant was returned to the Waukesha County Jail on 03/30/17 aftter walking away from the Huber Facility on 03/27/17. Defendant is currently in custody at the Waukesha County Jail.

04/07/17,   per Judge Carter: order revoking huber to be prepared.

Dated today, from the Court to the Defendant, in response to inmate communication received on 12/12/16. Court granted Huber on the 90 days of straight time for treatment purposes.  It is the responsibility of the jail administration to address what is and is not appropriate as treatment.  Mr. Lindner will have to work with the jail administration on this issue.

letter from United Community Center dated 8/18/16

Defendant Karl J Lindner in court with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements regarding sentencing.  Amy L. makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2  YEARS IMPRISONMENT (1 day credit)
  -  1  1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done
____Pay court ordered chid support
____No operation of motor vehicle without a valid driver's license   

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  9 Months - 1st 90 days straight time (Defendant may be allowed huber release for treatment ONLY and must be verified by treatment provider and subject to huber approval), remainder non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.  Defendant taken into custody.    

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Karl J Lindner in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rumpf requests to enter a plea today and set over sentencing for the Defendant to complete treatment. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. Counts #2 & #3 are dismissed and read in. Sentencing hearing set. Bail remains as fixed.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
